CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6 were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in CH 3 CN using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate (0.1 M) |
| CH 3 CN |
| glassy-carbon |
| polymer films (on glassy-carbon) |
| platinum wire |
| Ag wire |
| AgCl |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate (0.1 M) |
| CH 3 CN |
| glassy-carbon |
| polymer films |

These are the entities in the paragraph that can be considered as material names, as they refer to specific substances or materials used in the electrochemical measurements.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6 were carried out under nitrogen on a deoxygenated solution of tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate ( 0.1 M ) in CH 3 CN using a computer - controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation , a glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films , a platinum - wire auxiliary electrode , and an Ag wire anodized with AgCl as a pseudoreference electrode.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6 |
| Nitrogen |
| Deoxygenated solution |
| Tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate (0.1 M) |
| CH 3 CN |
| Computer-controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation |
| Glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films |
| Platinum-wire auxiliary electrode |
| Ag wire anodized with AgCl |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Electrochemical measurements for polymers P1-P6 |

The entities "nitrogen", "deoxygenated solution", "tetra-n-butylammonium hexafluorophosphate (0.1 M)", "CH 3 CN", "computer-controlled Zahner IM6e electrochemical workstation" are valid entities as they clearly refer to material properties or substances used in the electrochemical measurements.

The entities "polymers P1-P6" are not material properties or values, but rather the objects of the measurement. Therefore, they are not included in the table.

The entities "glassy-carbon working electrode coated with polymer films" and "Ag wire anodized with AgCl" are valid entities as they describe the material properties of the electrodes used in the measurements.
